title: anybodys excuse for panth top being absolutely broken is
body: "late game hes useless" but that doesnt mean the guy facing him should be useless as well.

replies.body: Yep, as soon as I see that panth bought flask and pots I know I'm up for 15 minutes of ~~sodomy~~ engaging gameplay

a) Significant sustain burns through his mana demanding Q harass if he overuses it.
b) His W literally drops him on top of you. Don't run away if he engages, fight back, especially if he's standing on top of your minions. If he decides to keep fighting, all of your minions will start wailing away at him.

Most pantheons playing top will waste their mana on E'ing minions and throwing their Q at you to poke you. Use that to your advantage early game before they can secure lane. Focus on early game lane sustain when dealing with a pantheon. Get doran's shield and ninja tabi, and make sure to use potions. Trust me, almost all pantheons will waste their mana on minions and poke. Think of them as someone fighting on bot lane. Notice that most people on bot lane will almost always be at half mana or less? For bot lane the side that keeps their mana up is almost always the side that wins lane. The same can be said of top lane and middle lane. Let pantheon waste his mana and you will gain control over top lane. I should know as I've played pantheon alot and have also played against pantheon alot.

Maokai, Rumble, Gnar, Irelia

All champions who can obliterate him without thinking twice about it, and that's only off the top of my head.

Lemme guess, you're playing Riven into a Pantheon?

EDIT: Just checked your match history, your two most played champions are Riven and Lee Sin... I didn't actually expect to be on the mark with my guess, but come on man, don't be a dummy, of course Pantheon is going to obliterate Riven.

If you see him blow E on minions just go harass him. Build armor. Be ranged. Ask for a gank.  He's hardly OP unless you are a newb.

> [{quoted}](name=Wizzleboom,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WqE4YLMv,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2014-12-25T04:04:16.676+0000)

easy, ill do just that just to beat one champ. doesnt mean hes op at all
your logic?

play a certain champ, a certain playstyle, a certain build. otherwise? you are going to lose.

> [{quoted}](name=Maximum Lee Sin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WqE4YLMv,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2014-12-25T04:06:52.022+0000)
>
> easy, ill do just that just to beat one champ. doesnt mean hes op at all
> your logic?
> 
> play a certain champ, a certain playstyle, a certain build. otherwise? you are going to lose.

The first line is champion pick. Certain champions will beat other champions and lose to a third set of champions. And then the rest are considered, more or less, equal matches.
Then, there's the build. If you're playing against a champion that's going to give you a hard time in the lane, counter-build to beat them. Pick one specific early item that you can use, something that will make them less difficult to handle.
And, yes, the final part is out-playing them. Recognizing how to defeat your opponent, and using that knowledge, is extremely important.

And, yes, in the laning phase, your main goal is to counter-play *one* champion. It doesn't matter which lane you're playing, even Jungle has counter-jungling and counter-ganking. You make *smart* early game plays to get a lead, and then you transition into the late game team fights by being equally smart, as well as working with your team.

If that's too much to process, by all means, quit League of Legends. It's only the basis of playing the game, after all.

Dude of course there are counter picks to Panth.  You can't expect to have an easy time with him on certain Champs.  That's the nature of the game.

I'm just saying that once you know his mechanics he is hardly OP.  He's free this week so try him yourself and find his weaknesses.
